riskAssessmentModels.description: A quantitative model that assigns a score to each identified risk based on its potential impact and likelihood.
riskAssessmentModels.usageGuidelines: Use for general risk assessment across various systems and environments.

riskAssessmentModels.description: Maps identified risks to the MITRE ATT&CK framework to understand tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) used by adversaries.
riskAssessmentModels.calculationMethod: Risk = Sum of (Tactic + Technique + Procedure) occurrences * DetectedIncidents
riskAssessmentModels.usageGuidelines: Use to align risk assessment with known adversary behaviors and improve defensive strategies.

riskAssessmentModels.description: Analyzes the stages of an attack lifecycle to identify and prioritize risks associated with each stage.
riskAssessmentModels.calculationMethod: Risk = Sum of risks identified at each stage of the kill chain
riskAssessmentModels.usageGuidelines: Use for threat hunting and incident response to disrupt adversary actions.

riskAssessmentModels.description: Evaluates the organization's ability to anticipate, withstand, recover from, and adapt to adverse conditions, stresses, attacks, or compromises on cyber resources.
riskAssessmentModels.calculationMethod: ResilienceScore = Average of (Preventative + Detective + Corrective + Adaptive) controls effectiveness
riskAssessmentModels.usageGuidelines: Use to measure and improve the organization's cyber resilience posture.

riskAssessmentModels.description: A real-time model that dynamically assesses risks based on current threat intelligence and system vulnerabilities.
riskAssessmentModels.usageGuidelines: Use for continuous monitoring and rapid response to emerging threats.
